meanings.definition: A large container or measure for grain, typically holding the equivalent of three bushels.
meanings.sent1: The farmer carried two emmers of wheat to the barn.
meanings.sent2: The emmers of rice were stacked neatly in the pantry.
meanings.sent3: The children used the emmers as drums, creating a rhythmic beat.
meanings.sent4: The emmers of knowledge in the library were waiting to be explored.
meanings.sent5: The emmers overflowed with golden corn, a sight to behold.

meanings.definition: To fill or be filled with emmers.
meanings.sent1: She emmersed the bucket in the well to draw water.
meanings.sent2: The field emmersed with colorful flowers in the spring.
meanings.sent3: The chef emmersed the pot with fragrant spices for the stew.
meanings.sent4: His mind was emmersed in thoughts of the upcoming exam.
meanings.sent5: The room slowly emmersed with the aroma of freshly baked bread.
